data.name: AssistanceGeneralSharedFieldsDesc
data.value: Each field of the creature can be marked as Shared. In combat mode, you can declare a number of instances for each creature (e.g. 5 goblins). The Shared feature means that the field is shared between all instances and will be only rendered once. For example, you probably don't want the competences of the globlins to be re-rendered for each instance of goblins, but in the other hand, you might want to track hit points individually for each instance.

data.value: This editor allows you to enrich your creatures with custom fields tailored to your gameplay needs. You can choose from various field types such as health bars, numerical stats, checkboxes, status conditions, and more. Each field is fully configurable and will be rendered consistently in both combat and creature views. You can add multiple fields, reorder them, or remove them at any time. For each type, a visual example and short description is provided below to help you decide.

data.name: AssistanceDetailedPopupField
data.value:
A composite, searchable popup that lets you bundle multiple pieces of content (text, markdown, templated HTML, or PDF) and show them in a clean list or grid, with optional grouping by name. It’s ideal for spells, abilities, feats, equipment cards, or any structured notes you want to browse quickly during play.

  • Switch between list and masonry grid layouts.
  • Built-in search across all pieces, using titles, keys, and extracted text.
  • Templated HTML mode supports CSS selectors + Handlebars templates for advanced layouts.
  • CSS is injected once for the whole popup for consistent styling across all pieces.

Detailed, step-by-step guidance is available directly in the popup’s content editor when you enable the Show editing help switch.
